content.description: The procedure NumOccurrences is intended to count and return the number of times targetWord appears in the list wordList. The procedure does not work as intended.
content.question:
For which of the following code segments will the call to NumOccurrences NOT return the intended value?

Select two answers.

choices.label: The figure presents two blocks of code that consist of 2 lines. Within both blocks of code there is a nested block of code. Line 1: [begin block] treeList ← [begin block] “birch”, “maple”, “birch” [end block] [end block] Line 2: [begin block] numOccurences [begin block] treeList, “birch” [end block] [end block]

Line 1: [begin block] treeList ← [begin block] “birch”, “maple”, “oak” [end block] [end block] Line 2: [begin block] numOccurences [begin block] treeList, “oak” [end block] [end block]

The figure presents two blocks of code that consist of 2 lines. Within both blocks of code there is a nested block of code. Line 1: [begin block] treeList ← [begin block] “birch”, “maple”, “oak” [end block] [end block] Line 2: [begin block] numOccurences [begin block] treeList, “spruce” [end block] [end block]

content.answer: The figure presents two blocks of code that consist of 2 lines. Within both blocks of code there is a nested block of code. Line 1: [begin block] treeList ← [begin block] “birch”, “maple”, “birch” [end block] [end block] Line 2: [begin block] numOccurences [begin block] treeList, “birch” [end block] [end block]

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Identify and correct errors in algorithms and programs, including error discovery through testing.
